first, sorry for my bad english syntax!
Ok, we are using JUnit, ANT and Abbot to create acceptance testing in 
a Java/Swing , everyting work fine but we need some things need to 
ameliored... 
 
1. All our testcase are dependant of a TestSuite with two testcases 
called Launch and OpenModuleX (they must be testcase, in the abbot 
terminology that a ScriptTestFixture (TestCase extension)).IT is  
possible to create a system that can do:
 
ant start a JUnit task ex:<test name="Module 2 Tests"> <formatter 
type="xml" /> </test>
 
run TestSuiteinit
run Test1
run Test2 - failure detected so re-run TestSuiteinit and then continu
run Test3
run Testx
etc..
 
ant create repport
 
 
2. IF want we want to do in 1 is impossible: can we put an 
haltonerror=yes and generate an report. if haltonerror=yes and a 
error is detected in the Junit process, ant stop and dont do the 
report task. I ask this because all our tests start with a 
assertframeshowing timeout=3000 so if the task dont stop 
(haltonerror=no) its take a while before we can get the report
 
ex: our antfile:
<target name="start test" depends="prepare">

<junit fork="yes" showoutput="yes">

<classpath> ... </classpath>

<formatter type="xml" />


<test name="Acceptance testsuite"> <formatter type="xml" /> </test>


</junit>

</target>


<target name="report">

<junitreport todir="${junit.report}">

<fileset dir="./"> <include name="TEST-*.xml"/> </fileset>

<report format="frames" todir="${junit.report}" />

</junitreport>

</target>
